content.question: A proton is located at <math alttext="y equals 0.50 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> above the surface of Earth <math alttext="y equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. In the absence of all other electrical charge, at approximately what value of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> should an electron be held fixed so that the proton remains stationary with respect to Earthâ€™s surface?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
